description: Number of linear geometries on n (unlabeled) points.
comments: For the labeled case see A056642.Also a(n) = 1 + number of non-isomorphic simple rank-3 matroids on n elements (see A058731); a(n) = number of non-isomorphic 2-partitions of a set of size n. For 1-partitions see A000041.
references: Blackburn et al., A catalogue of combinatorial geometries, Math. Comp 27 1973 155-166.
L. Comtet, Advanced Combinatorics, Reidel, 1974, p. 303, #42.
CRC Handbook of Combinatorial Designs, 1996, pp. 216, 697.
J. Doyen, Sur le nombre d'espaces lineaires non isomorphes de n points. Bull. Soc. Math. Belg. 19 1967 421-437.
D. G. Glynn, Rings of geometries II, J. Combin. Theory, A 49 (1988), 26-66.
D. G. Glynn, A geometrical isomorphism algorithm, Bull. ICA 7 (1993), 36-38.
G. Heathcote, Linear spaces on 16 points, J. Combin. Designs, 1 (1993), 359-378.
Ch. Pietsch, On the classification of linear spaces of order 11, J. Comb. Designs, 3 (1995), 185-193.
P. Robillard, On the weighted finite linear spaces. Bull. Soc. Math. Belg. 22 (1970), 227-241.
N. J. A. Sloane, A Handbook of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1973 (includes this sequence).
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: A. Betten and D. Betten, Linear spaces with at most 12 points, J. Combinatorial Designs, Volume 7, 1999, pp. 119 - 145.
J. Doyen, Sur le nombre d'espaces lineaires non isomorphes de n points [Annotated and scanned copy]
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, D.Glynn(AT)math.canterbury.ac.nz
extensions: Dead link to Betten paper replaced with CiteSeer entry (which has full text as cached PDF) _Robert Munafo_, Dec 13 2009
